doc.title: Island Women
doc.plot: 'Island Women',which is not an alternate title since it is THE title on the original US release print and all of the ads, press book and posters connected to the film; one of the taglines reads...'Everything you've heard about them is TRUE!...and the last time we checked, the plural 'them' fits 'women' more than it would a singular 'woman.' The semi-steamy story (more in promise than actual deliverance)is set in Nassau and finds Mike (Vince Edwards), an American charter boat captain, involved in a romance with tourist Jan (Marilee Earle) but Jan's aunt, Elizabeth (Marie Windsor) also has the hots for Mike and tries to break up the romance. She hides her bracelet in a straw bag belonging to Mike's mate, Eban (Leslie Scott), and then claims it was stolen. She then agrees to drop the theft charges if Mike will ditch Jan and go off with her.What's a poor guy to do? Well, mostly hang around and listen to Leslie Scott, Kay Barnes,Irene Williams and other Calypso performers sing "Cocoanut, Water, Rum and Gin", "Wanna Do Nothin' All Day" and "Island WOMEN" and watch "The Limbo" being danced.
